movies.title: The Conspiracy
movies.plot: A documentary about conspiracy theories takes a horrific turn after the filmmakers uncover an ancient and dangerous secret society.
movies.simplePlot: A documentary about conspiracy theories takes a horrific turn after the filmmakers uncover an ancient and dangerous secret society.

biography.bio: Most recently nominated for his portrayal of Captain John Slotter in the Netflix and CBC drama "Strange Empire", Aaron Poole is no stranger in Canada's screen community. Since appearing in Ed Gass-Donnelly's "This Beautiful City" at TIFF '08 (a role that garnered him ACTRA's Award for Best Actor and another Canadian Academy nomination), his work has received much acclaim. With roles that include two seasons in BBC America and Tom Fontana's "Copper"; starring in and producing Christopher MacBride's cult hit, "The Conspiracy"; and leading opposite both Donald and Kiefer Sutherland in "Forsaken", Aaron's opportunities have just begun to expand outside Canada. This year he will be seen stateside starring opposite Will Patton, Maggie Grace, and Maika Munroe in "The Scent of Rain and Lightning"; recurring opposite Dennis Haysbert and Julia Ormond in CBS/Syfy series "Incorporated", and supporting James Badge Dale in up-and-coming director David Prior's "The Empty Man" from 20th Century Fox.
biography.name: Aaron Poole

biography.bio: James Gilbert was born in 1982 in Ingramport, Nova Scotia, Canada. He is an actor, known for The Conspiracy (2012), Saw VI (2009) and The Corridor (2010).
biography.name: James Gilbert

biography.bio: Ian Anderson is known for his work on Cinderella Man (2005), Total Recall (2012) and RoboCop (2014).
biography.name: Ian Anderson

biography.bio: Peter Apostolopoulos is an actor and producer, known for Angel (2006), The Conspiracy (2012) and Separation (2013).
biography.name: Peter Apostolopoulos

biography.bio: It looks like we don't have any Biography for Roger Beck yet.
biography.name: Roger Beck

biography.bio: Angela Besharah was born on August 12, 1982 in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. She is an actress and producer, known for Les Kennedy (2011), Bitten (2014) and Lost Girl (2010).
biography.name: Angela Besharah

biography.bio: Bruce Clayton is known for his work on Torso: The Evelyn Dick Story (2002), Judgment Day: The Ellie Nesler Story (1999) and Haven (2001).
biography.name: Bruce Clayton

biography.bio: Laura de Carteret was born in January 1963 in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. She is an actress and executive, known for Dawn of the Dead (2004), Chloe (2009) and RED (2010).
biography.name: Laura de Carteret

biography.bio: Gavin Fox is known for his work on Connor, agent très spécial (2009), The Adventures of Sam & Max: Freelance Police (1997) and Ned et son Triton (1997).
biography.name: Gavin Fox

biography.bio: Ron Kennell was born on May 30, 1970 in Stratford, Ontario, Canada. He is an actor and writer, known for Pompéi (2014), Judy Garland, la vie d'une étoile (2001) and Dr. Cabbie (2014).
biography.name: Ron Kennell

biography.bio: Alina Lee is known for her work on SRAS - Alerte au virus mondial (2005), The Conspiracy (2012) and Let's Get Together: The Ultimate Experience (2016).
biography.name: Alina Lee

biography.bio: Ian Matthews is an actor, known for Gangland Undercover (2015), Orphan Black (2013) and Captives (2014).
biography.name: Ian Matthews

biography.bio: Adam Murciano is known for his work on Transitions (2016), Teenagers (2014) and Odd Squad (2014).
biography.name: Adam Murciano

biography.bio: Douglas Nyback is known for his work on Kit Kittredge: An American Girl (2008), Defiance (2013) and Incorporated (2016).
biography.name: Douglas Nyback

biography.bio: Bilingual actor, born and raised in the Saguenay-Lac-St-Jean region of Québec. He studied acting at the Actor's Studio in Montreal. Dennis has brought his linguistic versatility to many productions across Canada. He has premièred roles by some of the country's finest writers, including Michel Tremblay, John Murrell, George F. Walker, David Fennario and Daniel MacIvor. He has also played the über-everyman on television, film and stage, and his fair share of bumbling cops. A character actor, O'Connor finds artistic challenges mostly on the stage. His classical roles have included Tartuffe for Théâtre français de Toronto, and Falstaff in an indie production of Henry IV, Part One for the past several summers, he has played Leopold Bloom in the James Joyce ''Ulysses'' / Bloomsday celebrations in Toronto; roles which require great verbal and emotional dexterity. He is most notably remembered for his role as Gaston Talbot in Larry Tremblay's The Dragonfly of Chicoutimi. He created the English language première of Michel Tremblay's Narrator in For the Pleasure of Seeing Her Again (Encore une fois, si vous le permettez). In 2010, he will perform in disguise room, a solo piece written for him by e. schuhe, for SeeshoplaytrickS, in Berlin, Germany. He is a veteran of over three hundred radio dramas for CBC / Radio-Canada. O'Connor has had 4 Best Actor nominations for Toronto's Dora Awards.
biography.name: Dennis O'Connor

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Nominated Best North American Independent Film
